item.title: Effects of local drug crisis evident in Kamsack, Sask.
item.description:
Effects of local drug crisis evident in Kamsack, Sask.

If the first step to recovery is admitting there's a problem, three First Nations around Kamsack, in east-central Saskatchewan, have reached that point. ​Leaders of the Federation of Saskatchewan Indian Nations and the Key, Cote and Keeseekoose First Nations sounded the alarm this week about a crisis in their communities.

item.title: One universe, please! | Adrian Buzatu | TEDxBucharest
item.description:
One universe, please! | Adrian Buzatu | TEDxBucharest

How has the universe started and how do you create a Universe? Well, you need a recipe, just like in baking cakes! And while we have known the same ingredients for over 50 years, the discovery of the Higgs boson has changed the way we understand our universe.

item.title: Prisoner tunnels through cell wall to get high on stolen drugs
item.description:
Prisoner tunnels through cell wall to get high on stolen drugs

ALAMY In a Colditz-style operation, he removed bricks so he could help himself to pills and liquid medicine. Once stoned, he headed back to his cell where he was found slumped on his bed by prison officers. The alarm was raised when a staff member spotted bricks had been taken out of a wall.

item.title: The Arrest of Chumlee Of 'Pawn Stars': Was He Dealing Drugs?
item.description:
The Arrest of Chumlee Of 'Pawn Stars': Was He Dealing Drugs?

Celebrity News When police raided the home of Chumlee of Pawn Stars fame, it was for sexual assault charges. We haven't heard of any evidence to support that charge, but other items were found in Chumlee's home that present the possibility that he was dealing drugs.

item.title: Harlesden man admits plot to smuggle £24m drugs hidden in carpets
item.description:
Harlesden man admits plot to smuggle £24m drugs hidden in carpets

Archant A Harlesden has admitted plotting to smuggle £24million worth of drugs into the country by hiding them in wrapped up carpets. Left to right: Jon Euesden, Martin Beckett, Stuart Openshaw and Lee Jones Marc Howell, 45, of Bramshill Road, was part of a five-strong gang behind the audacious scheme which involved cannabis being concealed in industrial tubes inside the carpets.

item.title: Tom Bean dropoff box for unwanted drugs hits milestone
item.description:
Tom Bean dropoff box for unwanted drugs hits milestone

February is National Heart Health Awareness Month and Texoma Medical Center has scheduled its annual Heart Health event to raise awareness and provide education on living a healthy life.

item.title: Lib Dems say drugs imprisonment approach must change
item.description:
Lib Dems say drugs imprisonment approach must change

Nearly 1,000 people have been imprisoned for possession of drugs in the last five years rather than sent for treatment or education, Scottish Government figures show. An average of 200 people a year are imprisoned for possession but just 55 a year are given drug treatment and testing orders, figures obtained by the Liberal Democrats reveal.

item.title: Cannabis Industry Awaits Ruling in Long-Running Lawsuit Over Federal Preemption - Marijuana Business Daily
item.description:
Cannabis Industry Awaits Ruling in Long-Running Lawsuit Over Federal Preemption - Marijuana Business Daily

By Omar Sacirbey Arizona attorney Steven White is leaving the legal profession to concentrate on his marijuana business, but he's fighting perhaps the biggest battle of his career before moving on. White argued his last case on March 3 in a lawsuit pitting his client - plaintiff White Mountain Heath Center of Sun City, Arizona - against Maricopa County, which is trying to prevent the dispensary from opening.

item.title: Six arrested after drugs raid on Warrington nightclub
item.description:
Six arrested after drugs raid on Warrington nightclub

Police have arrested six people following a drugs raid at a Warrington nightclub. Revellers were searched by a sniffer dog as they left Reef Bar early today. Specially-trained officers carried out a thorough examination of the club and recovered a large amount of illegal drugs.
